intro: Pedicularis altissima, commonly known as the tall monkeyflower, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems that can reach up to 2 meters in height, making it one of the tallest species in the Pedicularis genus. The plant produces showy, spurred flowers that are typically pink or red, with a distinctive hood-like structure. It thrives in moist, rocky habitats and is often found in mountain meadows and stream banks. Due to its striking appearance and ecological significance, it is a notable species in alpine botany.
